lines.text: Eyes, hair, body, and mind. That's the worst part. Can't stop it either. It's not senility. My grandfather told me about senility, I'm not worried about that. My grandfather said, "When you become senile, you won't know it."

"George Washington cut down his father's cherry tree, and George's father said, 'George, why did you cut this cherry tree down?' And George said, 'Father, I cannot tell a lie, for it was I.' And that's all that is said about George Washington's father. You don't even know George Washington's father's real name, except that it was "George Washington's Father."

I was eleven years old. In the projects. August, 174 degrees Fahrenheit. Playing basketball. My mother came out and said, "Do you know how hot it is... get in this house!" I said, "But Ma..." She said, "You do it!" I went in the house so mad, sat down hard on the sofa. Couldn't even breathe good.

My father came by, and I said, "Dad, Mom won't let me go out..." My father said, "You do what your mother says!" And I stood up, looked him in both eyes, and said, "I hate both of you! And I'm running away from home!" And my father lifted me up over his head, and said, "How far do you want to go?" He didn't know I was THE Bill Cosby.
